description: Amazon Linux 2 CIS Benchmark v3.0.0 - Section 1.6 Configure Command Line Warning Banners

controls.title: Ensure message of the day is configured properly
controls.description: The contents of /etc/motd are displayed to users after login and function as a message of the day for automated communication to users.
controls.remediation: Edit /etc/motd with the appropriate contents according to your site policy, remove any instances of \m, \r, \s, \v or references to the OS platform

controls.title: Ensure local login warning banner is configured properly
controls.description: The contents of /etc/issue are displayed to users prior to login for local terminals. Warning banners inform users who are attempting to login to the system of their legal status regarding the system and must include the name of the organization that owns the system.
controls.remediation: Edit /etc/issue with the appropriate contents according to your site policy, remove any instances of \m, \r, \s, \v or references to the OS platform

controls.title: Ensure remote login warning banner is configured properly
controls.description: The contents of /etc/issue.net are displayed to users prior to login for remote connections from configured services. Warning banners inform users who are attempting to login to the system of their legal status regarding the system.
controls.remediation: Edit /etc/issue.net with the appropriate contents according to your site policy, remove any instances of \m, \r, \s, \v or references to the OS platform

controls.title: Ensure access to /etc/motd is configured
controls.description: The /etc/motd file is used to display a message of the day to all users. The file needs to be protected from unauthorized changes.

controls.title: Ensure access to /etc/issue is configured
controls.description: The /etc/issue file contains a message or system identification information to be printed before the login prompt. The file needs to be protected from unauthorized changes.

controls.title: Ensure access to /etc/issue.net is configured
controls.description: The /etc/issue.net file contains a message or system identification information to be printed before the login prompt for remote connections. The file needs to be protected from unauthorized changes.
